Demography

class phasegen.demography.Demography

Bases: object

Base class for demographic scenarios.

n_epochs: Optional[int]

Number of epochs.

n_pops: int

Number of populations / demes.

pop_names: List[str]

Population names.

migration_rates: Dict[Tuple[str, str], float]

Migration rates.

__init__()

Initialize the demography.

logger

The logger instance

Plot the population size over time.

Parameters:

  • show (bool) – Whether to show the plot.

  • file (str) – File to save the plot to.

  • t_max (float) – Maximum time to plot.

Return type:

Returns:

Axes object.

class phasegen.demography.TimeHomogeneousDemography(pop_size: Union[float, Dict[str, float], List[float]] = 1, migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)

Bases: Demography

Demographic scenario where the population size is constant.

n_epochs: int = 1

Number of epochs.

__init__(pop_size: Union[float, Dict[str, float], List[float]] = 1, migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)

Create a constant demographic scenario.

Parameters:

  • pop_size (Union[float, Dict[str, float], List[float]]) – A single population size, or a list of population sizes for various population, or a dictionary mapping population names to population sizes.

  • migration_matrix (Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], ndarray]) – Migration matrix. If None, no migration is assumed. Either a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij} or a list of lists or a numpy array.

n_pops: int

Number of populations / demes.

pop_names: List[str]

Population names.

migration_rates: Dict[Tuple[str, str], float]

Migration rates as a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij}

property pop_size_list: List[float]

Get the population sizes as a list in the same order as the population names.

Returns:

Population sizes.

  • t_max (float) – Maximum time to plot.

class phasegen.demography.PiecewiseTimeHomogeneousDemography(pop_sizes: Union[List[float], Dict[str, Iterable[float]]] = [1], times: Union[List[float], Dict[str, Iterable[float]]] = [0], migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)

Bases: Demography

Piecewise constant demographic scenario.

__init__(pop_sizes: Union[List[float], Dict[str, Iterable[float]]] = [1], times: Union[List[float], Dict[str, Iterable[float]]] = [0], migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)

The population sizes and times these changes occur backwards in time.

Parameters:

  • pop_sizes (Union[List[float], Dict[str, Iterable[float]]]) – List of population sizes if there is only one population, or a dictionary mapping population names to lists of population sizes.

  • times (Union[List[float], Dict[str, Iterable[float]]]) – List of times at which the population sizes change if there is only one population, or a dictionary mapping population names to lists of times at which the population sizes change. Time starts at zero and increases backwards in time.

  • migration_matrix (Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], ndarray]) – Migration matrix. If None, no migration is assumed. Either a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij} or a list of lists or a numpy array where the rows correspond to the source population and the columns to the destination population. Note that migration rate for which the source and destination population are the same are ignored.

pop_names: List[str]

Population names.

n_epochs: Optional[int]

Number of epochs.

n_pops: int

Number of populations / demes.

migration_rates: Dict[Tuple[str, str], float]

Migration matrix as a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij}

static flatten(times: Dict[str, List[float]], pop_sizes: Dict[str, List[float]])

Flatten population sizes and times into a list of times and a list of population sizes.

Parameters:

  • pop_sizes (Dict[str, List[float]]) – Dictionary mapping population names to lists of population sizes.

  • times (Dict[str, List[float]]) – Dictionary mapping population names to lists of times.

Return type:

(List[float], Dict[str, List[float]])

Returns:

List of times and list of population sizes.

plot(show: bool = True, file: str = None, t_max: float = None, max_epochs: int = 100)

Plot the population size over time.

Parameters:

  • file (str) – File to save the plot to.

  • t_max (float) – Maximum time to plot.

  • max_epochs (int) – Maximum number of epochs to plot.

logger

class phasegen.demography.ContinuousDemography(trajectory: Callable[[float], Union[Dict[str, float], float]], min_size: float = 0.001, start_size: float = 1, max_growth: float = 1, migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)

Bases: PiecewiseTimeHomogeneousDemography

Continuous demographic scenario (which is discretized dynamically based on the increase/decrease in population size).

__init__(trajectory: Callable[[float], Union[Dict[str, float], float]], min_size: float = 0.001, start_size: float = 1, max_growth: float = 1, migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)

Create a continuous demographic scenario.

Parameters:

  • trajectory (Callable[[float], Union[Dict[str, float], float]]) – Function that returns the population size at a given time. Either a single value or a dictionary with population names as keys.

  • min_size (float) – Minimum discretization interval

  • start_size (float) – Population size at the start of new epochs.

  • max_growth (float) – Maximum absolute growth rate compared to the previous population size.

  • migration_matrix (Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], ndarray]) – Migration matrix. If None, no migration is assumed. Either a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij} or a list of lists or a numpy array.

trajectory

Population size trajectory function

min_size

Minimum discretization interval

start_size

Step size at the start of new epochs

max_growth

Maximum absolute growth rate compared to the previous population size

pop_names: List[str]

Population names

property times: Iterable[float]

Get the times at which the population sizes change.

Returns:

Times.

Returns:

Population sizes.

Return type:

class phasegen.demography.ExponentialDemography(growth_rate: Union[float, Dict[str, float]], N0: Union[float, Dict[str, float]] = 1, min_size: float = 0.001, start_size: float = 1, max_growth: float = 1, migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)

Bases: ContinuousDemography

Demographic scenario where the population size grows exponentially.

__init__(growth_rate: Union[float, Dict[str, float]], N0: Union[float, Dict[str, float]] = 1, min_size: float = 0.001, start_size: float = 1, max_growth: float = 1, migration_matrix: Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], numpy.ndarray] = None)
Parameters:

  • growth_rate (Union[float, Dict[str, float]]) – Exponential growth rate so that at time t in the past we have N0 * exp(- growth_rate * t). Either a single value or a dictionary with population names as keys.

  • N0 (Union[float, Dict[str, float]]) – Initial population size (only used if growth_rate is specified). Either a single value or a dictionary with population names as keys.

  • min_size (float) – Minimum discretization interval

  • start_size (float) – Population size at the start of new epochs.

  • max_growth (float) – Maximum absolute growth rate compared to the previous population size.

  • migration_matrix (Union[Dict[Tuple[str, str], float], List[List[float]], ndarray]) – Migration matrix. If None, no migration is assumed. Either a dictionary of the form {(pop_i, pop_j): m_ij} or a list of lists or a numpy array.

static flatten(times: Dict[str, List[float]], pop_sizes: Dict[str, List[float]])

Flatten population sizes and times into a list of times and a list of population sizes.

Parameters:

  • pop_sizes (Dict[str, List[float]]) – Dictionary mapping population names to lists of population sizes.

  • times (Dict[str, List[float]]) – Dictionary mapping population names to lists of times.

Return type:

(List[float], Dict[str, List[float]])

Returns:

List of times and list of population sizes.
